intro: Ardisia cardenasii, commonly known as the Cretan beauty or Cretan evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myricaceae. It is native to the island of Crete and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Ardisia cardenasii is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate with its drought-resistant properties. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
